Takeaways from the $355 million civil fr.title: Takeaways from the $355 million civil fraud ruling against Donald Trump
Takeaways from the $355 million civil fr.summary: Judge Arthur Engoron fined Donald Trump $355 million for fraud and barred him from serving as a company director in New York for three years. Combined with a separate $83 million judgment, Trump's total fines reach $438 million recently.
key_takeaways: Judge Engoron fined Trump $355 million for fraudulently inflating property values.
Trump is barred from serving as a New York company director for three years.
The fines add to Trump's recent $83 million defamation penalty for a total of $438 million.

Arthur Engoron.name: Arthur Engoron
Arthur Engoron.description: The judge who fined Donald Trump and barred him from serving as a director in New York companies.

Donald Trump.name: Donald Trump
Donald Trump.description: Trump was fined $355 million for fraud and barred from company directorship in New York for three years.

Trump Organization.name: Trump Organization
Trump Organization.description: Engoron declined to dissolve the Trump Organization but installed independent oversight.

New York.name: New York
New York.description: Location where Donald Trump has been barred from serving as a director of a company.

Missouri has some of the weakest gun law.title: Missouri has some of the weakest gun laws in the US. Here’s how that is impacting the Kansas City shooting investigation
Missouri has some of the weakest gun law.summary: A mass shooting at a Super Bowl celebration rally in Kansas City left one dead and 23 injured. Missouri's weak gun laws are blamed for its high rate of gun violence.
key_takeaways: Missouri has weak gun laws and a high rate of firearm-related deaths.
A 27% rise in Missouri's gun homicide rate followed the repeal of a gun law.
Investigating gun crimes in Missouri is made difficult by lax gun laws.

Joe Biden.name: Joe Biden
Joe Biden.description: Called for Congress to pass 'reasonable gun safety laws' after the Kansas City mass shooting.

Kansas City.name: Kansas City
Kansas City.description: Location of the Super Bowl celebration rally where the mass shooting occurred.

Missouri.name: Missouri
Missouri.description: A state known for weak gun laws and high rates of gun violence.

Caitlin Clark-onomics and the new era of.title: Caitlin Clark-onomics and the new era of profitability in college sports
Caitlin Clark-onomics and the new era of.summary: Caitlin Clark has become the all-time leading scorer in women's college basketball while showcasing the economic potential of athletes in the new era of college sports profitability.
key_takeaways: Caitlin Clark is the all-time leading scorer in women's college basketball.
She has signed endorsement deals worth an estimated $818,000.
Clark's success reflects the marketing power of female athletes in college sports.

Caitlin Clark.name: Caitlin Clark
Caitlin Clark.description: Women's college basketball's all-time leading scorer and an influential economic figure in college sports.

Gwen Stefani says she has to relearn No.title: Gwen Stefani says she has to relearn No Doubt songs ahead of ‘amazing’ Coachella reunion
Gwen Stefani says she has to relearn No.summary: Gwen Stefani is brushing up on No Doubt's classic hits for their reunion at Coachella in April, having forgotten some lyrics and not yet started rehearsals.
key_takeaways: Gwen Stefani forgot the lyrics to some No Doubt songs ahead of their Coachella reunion.
No Doubt last performed together almost a decade ago and will play at Coachella.
Other artists headlining Coachella include Lana Del Rey, Doja Cat, and Tyler, The Creator.

Gwen Stefani.name: Gwen Stefani
Gwen Stefani.description: Gwen Stefani is revisiting No Doubt's songs for their upcoming performance at Coachella.

Coachella.name: Coachella
Coachella.description: No Doubt is reuniting for a performance at the Coachella music festival.
